etymologies: Middle English (denoting a runner or running messenger): from Latin, ‘runner’, from curs- (see cursive). cursor (sense 2 of the noun) dates from the late 16th century

definitions: a movable indicator on a computer screen identifying the point that will be affected by input from the user, for example showing where typed text will be inserted.
shortDefinitions: movable indicator on computer screen identifying point

definitions: the transparent slide engraved with a hairline that is part of a slide rule and is used for marking a point on the rule while bringing a point on the central sliding portion up to it.
shortDefinitions: transparent slide engraved with hairline that is part of slide rule
